Text.Name: Place_Level2Base
Text.Desc: Lv.2 Location Templates

Text.Name: Place_DanXia1
Text.Desc: A natural karst cave at the foot of Mt. Sunshade, with winding passages and spectacular scenery. Deep inside the cave, there is a statue of the Avarice Lord erected for people to worship. It is a perfect place to retreat into isolation for practice.

Text.Name: Place_DanXia2
Text.Desc: A precipice at the top of Mt. Sunshade. Under the dimming sunlight at dusk, it offers a breathtakingly glorious view of mountain scenery.

Text.Name: Place_DanXia3
Text.Desc: A magical pond located deep in Mt. Sunshade. Lotus flowers sprout vigorously in the lake, which seems bottomless, connecting to the water vein on the earth's crust. It is said that the Prism Lotus—the Spirit Root of the Sunshade Abode is planted here.

Text.Name: Place_KunLun1
Text.Desc: A stone platform at the southern foot of Mt. Kunlun, with many enigmatic patterns carved on it. It is said that in the ancient age, the Eastern King granted immortality here to his subordinates and ascended into heaven, leaving a Taoist Law for later generations to find.

Text.Name: Place_KunLun2
Text.Desc: An endless cave deep in Mt. Kunlun, with complex and confusing passages and streams. It is said to be directly connected to and blessed by the Dragon's Vein, and thus the Kunlun Palace cultivates its Spirit Root—the Ocher Essence here.

Text.Name: Place_KunLun2_1
Text.Desc: A regular cavern inside the Drake Cave. It looks fairly ordinary, but emits a strange and mystical aura, which cannot be sensed unless it was someone who knew the Drake Cave inside and out. There seems to be some peculiar, natural patterns at the entry of the cavern.

Text.Name: Place_TianJi1
Text.Desc: A deep ravine between the soaring precipices at the Heavenstep Peak, creating a giant vortex of Qi that spins without halt; even birds cannot fly over it. It is told that the Skydome Palace has the Spirit Root—Sage Fruit planted on the precipice of the ravine.

Text.Name: Place_TianJi2
Text.Desc: A narrow pass on the way to the top of the Heavenstep Peak. Purity Leaf grows everywhere on the sides of the pass, anyone who approaches will forget all troubles and feel soothed and peaceful, thus the name Celeste Pass. Through it is the top of the Heavenstep Peak, where the Skydome Palace is based.

Text.Name: Place_JiuHua1
Text.Desc: A village at the foot of Mt. Lucian. Blessed by the Purple Cloud Temple, the village is populated and thriving as a community. There is a huge vein of jade stones nearby, on which the villagers make a living by extracting and selling them to the Purple Cloud Temple.

Text.Name: Place_JiuHua2
Text.Desc: A popular scenic spot on Mt. Lucian. Standing by the Wyvern Pool, one can see the magnificent view of the surging sea of clouds. Legend has it that a sage once grazed dragons here in the ancient age.

Text.Name: Place_JiuHua3
Text.Desc: A popular scenic spot on Mt. Lucian. The dry trunks of two giant sycamore trees still remain till this day. Legend has it that a phoenix once perched on this cliff in the ancient age.

Text.Name: Place_LongHu1
Text.Desc: An ultimate attraction on Mt. Tiger Paw. The water rushes straight down from the top of the climbing mountain, roaring as loud as a majestic dragon flying across the sky.

Text.Name: Place_LongHu2
Text.Desc: A thick forest at the foot of Mt. Tiger Paw, in which many trees are well over several hundred years old. Rumor has it that Phoenixwood also grows here. Mt. Tiger Paw has its Spirit Root planted here for its richness in Wood Qi.

Text.Name: Place_Shu1
Text.Desc: Standing on the western peak of Mt. Shu, the cliff has a beautiful scenic view and is populated with spiritual and magical animals. This is where the earth's vein leaks out Qi, thus creating many rare ores like Fire Copper inside the mountain. The Immortal Caerulea planted the spiritual medicine Red Fruit here due to its abundance in the element of Fire.

Text.Name: Place_Shu2
Text.Desc: One of the twelve caves in Mt. Shu, also where the founder of Blue Lotus Temple retreated into seclusion. Legend has it that the Immortal Caerulea left a secret here before his ascension; however, no one seems to be able to found it for thousands of years.

Text.Name: Place_Shu3
Text.Desc: One of the renowned caves in Mt. Shu, hidden atop the northern peak of the mountain. Exposed Fire Copper veins abound in the cave, causing an overflow of Fire Element for thousands of years and creating the glimmer inside, hence the name Glimmer Cave. It is a perfect place for practice.

Text.Name: Place_Shu4
Text.Desc: One of the twelve renowned caves in Mt. Shu. Legend has it that a holy spring of Earth Flux is hidden deep inside the cave, and only destiny can be one's guide to finding it.

Text.Name: Place_Shu5
Text.Desc: A dark and meandering cave inside Mt. Shu, with the swords carried by each generation of sword immortals from the Blue Lotus Temple hidden in it.

Text.Name: Place_WuLian1
Text.Desc: A sacred pond that lies within a caldera atop the once volcanic Mt. Nelumbo. The Immortal Nelumbo performed a miracle stolen from the ways of heaven to seal the volcano and established the sect here. Legend has it that there is a Life Spring in the pool, and only the most fortunate of all will be able to find it.

Text.Name: Place_WuLian2
Text.Desc: A mystical forest at the back of Mt. Nelumbo. When it rains, the forest becomes misty and atmospheric like a fairyland. There once was a scholar with terminal disease who dove into and then came back from the forest. He speaks of an immortal with a wooded sword in their left hand that controls the force of nature and a white jade in their right hand that cures all diseases, calling themselves the 'Immortal Pearlwood'. Hence the name 'Pearlwood Rainforest'.

Text.Name: Place_BaiMan1
Text.Desc: Every time the disciples at Mt. Hundred Insects kill magic beasts, they will bring their bodies to the Deathknell Cave and seal them inside. The bodies will then transform into puppets via the Qi of death to guard the mountain. If a new body sent there has not completed the transformation, one might be able to take out its Soul Pearl .

Text.Name: Place_BaiMan2
Text.Desc: A pit used by Mt. Hundred Insects to keep and feed serpents. Once a serpent becomes mature enough, it will be taken out and its blood will be collected for the disciples' cultivation.

Text.Name: Place_BaiMan3
Text.Desc: A place for Mt. Hundred Insects to keep their beasts and animals, where something went horribly wrong. It has been gradually abandoned and no one is allowed to enter.

Text.Name: Place_XianKong1
Text.Desc: A bottomless pit in Mt. Pitfall, and its emission of a magnetic field oftentimes attracts meteors here. It is said that a cultivator once found a piece of lumina core here. However, the treasure is enigmatic, and most people would leave empty-handed.

Text.Name: Place_Hei4
Text.Desc: A forest at the foot of Mt. Blackstone, the bowels of which are covered with thistles and thorns that few men and animals can set foot in. It has barely been visited by people since the ancient times; thus, there are rare trees that have survived over a thousand years all around the forest. It is abundant in Wood Element, making a perfect place for cultivation.

Text.Name: Place_HeHuan1
Text.Desc: There is a big island near the Exultant Isle, inside of which is a misty lake called Safeward Seas. Once inside, one can have visions of all kinds of love-hate relationships, and will possibly indulge oneself and forget about time if not careful.

Text.Name: Place_HeHuan2
Text.Desc: A deep lake on the Exultant Isle. Legend has it that deep inside the lake, there is a den of Toxagons that often attack nearby cultivators. It is also told that there is a holy spring of Earth Flux and the Toxagon den is only a misleading story made up by the Exultant Isle.

Text.Name: Place_Desert1
Text.Desc: A large evil sect hidden deep in the Great Desert. It usually avoids attracting too much attention and has been in hiding for a thousand years, thus barely known to the outside world. It was not until recently when the Dragon Cliff inscriptions were found in the sanctum of evils, did the sect reemerge in the world.

Text.Name: Place_Desert2
Text.Desc: An area of barren wastelands deep in the Great Desert, constantly hit with sandstorms. The air here is filled with a dense Qi of the Earth Element. It is a great place for cultivation, only if one can withstand the terrible environment.

Text.Name: Place_Desert3
Text.Desc: A bizarre cave hidden deep in the Great Desert. It is extremely hot inside, which is said to possess a natural treasure of the Fire Element.

Text.Name: Place_Desert4
Text.Desc: A small village at the edge of the Great Desert. Most residents in the village are demon descendants. They are generally belligerent and fearless, and hunt beasts in the desert for a living.

Text.Name: Place_SouthForest1
Text.Desc: There used to be a forest of peach trees that spread over hundreds of miles on the bad lands of the Wild South, but few people have come here to pick the ripe fruits before they drop to the ground and rot. For thousands of years, the rotten peaches gradually formed the noxious air that never dissipates.

Text.Name: Place_SouthForest2
Text.Desc: The founder of the southern demonic cult—the Demon Emperor's tomb. The chamber was built out of a whole meteorite stone and buried deep in the ground. The tomb is strictly surrounded by the Cosmos Spirits. Without the secret way to open it, anyone who touches the tomb will immediately die no matter how experienced they are.

Text.Name: Place_SouthForest3
Text.Desc: A valley deep in the Wild South, most of which are dangerous thick woods with snakes and insects crawling inside. However, its damp environment is especially suitable for the growth of the magical medicine—Gnarled Vine, so cultivators often come here to seek an easier way to immortality.

Text.Name: Place_Snowfield1
Text.Desc: An untrodden valley in the Great Snowland, filled with Qi. Some ginseng here have been growing for over a hundred years.

Text.Name: Place_Snowfield2
Text.Desc: A magical lake deep in the Great Snowland that never freezes. It is told that there is a Prism Lotus growing in the lake, but only the luckiest cultivator will be able to find it. The source of the water connects directly to the deep end of the earth's crust—the core of the magnetic field. No one can escape the pull once stuck inside. Before Fu, the ultimate overlord as well as the Emperor of Demons that once ruled the society of cultivators, was struck dead by the hand of the gods, he hid all his possessions in a golden box and let it sink down the lake. The box was caught by the pull of the magnetic field, and it never faced the light of day again.

Text.Name: Place_Snowfield3
Text.Desc: Snow-covered plains that stretch to no end, where blizzards never stop. This place is rich in Ice Crystal Ores.

Text.Name: Place_FertileField1
Text.Desc: A small town north of the great river.

Text.Name: Place_FertileField2
Text.Desc: A small town on the northern plains of the river. People here are honest and peace-loving. most of which make a living by mining the jade stone ores near the village.

Text.Name: Place_FertileField3
Text.Desc: A village built by the lake, and the villagers mostly make a living on farming and fishing.

Text.Name: Place_FertileField4
Text.Desc: A famous mountain south of the river, with beautiful views of scenery, an agreeable weather, and most of all, abundant Lingzhi mushrooms.

Text.Name: Place_FertileField5
Text.Desc: A famous mountain south of the river. The Law leading through it is meandering and confusing, which means even animals as agile as monkeys cannot climb over it. There are a few exposed ore veins of spirit stone in the mountain. Though not worthy of any large-scale mining operation, rogue cultivators would often go in and mine some for their own use. Rumors has it that a cultivator once sensed strong Qi of Metal Element here, and it seems that the Sage Fruit, one of the Spirit Roots, is hidden somewhere in the mountain.

Text.Name: Place_CentralPlains1
Text.Desc: A famous mountain surrounded by thick clouds in the hinterland of Central Plains, thus the name Mt. Cloudsreach. It is rich in Cinnabar, and alchemist cultivators often come here to gather them.

Text.Name: Place_CentralPlains2
Text.Desc: The genius doctor used to practice alchemy here, but now only an abandoned mansion is standing here with nothing left inside. Most of the spiritual herbs in the garden have dried up; only the resilient Spirit Leaves were able to survive and spread across the mountain. It is said that the genius doctor used to plant the Spirit Root Ocher Essence here, which has attained spirituality. Only the luckiest of the adventurers is able to find it.

Text.Name: Place_CentralPlains3
Text.Desc: A bizarre mountain in the hinterland of Central Plains, with its top flat as an open field, created through the hands of the gods. At the top of the mountain, there is a List of Talents that recorded the name of all notable people in the world. Therefore, it has strong and dense Qi of Metal Element, making it a good place for cultivation.

Text.Name: Place_CentralPlains4
Text.Desc: A village built against mountains in the hinterland of Central Plains. Generations of villagers have been practicing medicine, making a living through herb gardens on mountains nearby.

Text.Name: Place_CentralPlains5
Text.Desc: A village in the hinterland of Central Plains, famous for its textile manufacture.

Text.Name: Place_BirthPlace11
Text.Desc: A small village, where most residents make a living on farming and hunting.

Text.Name: Place_BirthPlace12
Text.Desc: A small mountain on the southern borderlands, densely covered in trees and other types of vegetation, where people sometimes go and gather herbs to make a living.

Text.Name: Place_BirthPlace13
Text.Desc: A brown-colored stone mountain, used to be a quarry for the government, later abandoned because of the war. Now, many villagers at the foot of the mountain plant and pick cotton for a living.

Text.Name: Place_BirthPlace14
Text.Desc: A stone mountain, rich in metallic ores but seldom visited by people.

Text.Name: Place_BirthPlace15
Text.Desc: The ruins of Taiyi Sect.

Text.Name: Place_BirthPlace16
Text.Desc: The sand here is as black as ink. On the bank, there is a mysterious entrance to an underground casino. Only people lucky enough will be able to find it.
